transcripts.text: National embarrassment and international laughing stock.  Sadiq Khan has bankrupted Transport for London.  Such has been his flagrant disregard for basic economics that his mismanagement of the city has now resulted in him having to go to Boris Johnson to beg for a bailout.  Who could have seen this coming?  Well, me actually, back in June 2019.  Take a look at this.

He has cost the TfL 640 million pounds by freezing fares so they are not keeping up with inflation.  Meanwhile TfL employee costs have increased from 4.9 million pounds to 10.8 million pounds since he took over as mayor.  He's also failed to reduce the cost of bus travel as he promised.

If you spend more than you take in, of course, eventually you will run out of money.  And now the egregious weasel Khan is using the coronavirus as cover for his own inept management of the city's resources.  They are currently running a £600 million a month deficit and money is set to run out unless Big Buck's daddy Rishi Sunak finds another magic money tree somewhere.  In addition, he's had to raise fares again, again citing COVID-19.  But as Sean Bailey, his mayoral rival, has pointed out, this is a flagrant lie.  His initial price freeze, keeping ticket prices below inflation while doubling staff wages, is clearly the ultimate thing to blame here.  And let's not even get into the awful crime situation in London again.  And so I call, as I have so many times before, for Sadiq Khan to resign.  Sadiq Khan resign.  Sadiq Khan resign.  Now get out.
